($5000)</p><</if>><</if>> <<if $quest_bro is 10>>[[Present odd writings|Scaving][$scaving to 64, $adpos to 0]]<</if>> <<if $oldone4 gte 11 and $askedwright is undefined>>[[Ask for professor Arkwright|MScaving][$mscaving to 72, $adpos to 0]]<</if>> </div> <div class="alt2"> <<include OptionsOther>> <<if $action is 1>> [[Faction overview|Factions][$activefac to 14]] <</if>> <<if $action is 3 or $action is 4 or $action is 2>> [[Back|HisSoc][$action to 1]] <</if>> </div> <div class="alt3"> <<if $faction.his.standing gte 10>> <div class="interactbox"> <br> <div class="tex17px center">''HISTORICAL SOC. ACTIONS''<br>$hisactions/2<div> </div> <<else>> <<include InteractStart>> <</if>> </div> <div class="alt4"> <<include OptionsETC>> </div> </div> </div> <div class="acts2"> <div class="alt1b"> <<include HealthSystem>> </div> <div class="alt2b"> <<include StamSystem>> </div> <div class="alt3b"> <<include Time>> </div> <div class="alt4b"> <<include alt4>> </div> <div class="alt6b"> <<include HomeGo>> </div> </div> </div> </div> <</nobr>><div id="wrapper2"> <<if $history is 1>> <center><h2>- THE GREAT CITY -</h2></center> <hr color="black"> Ikaanos city, commonly known as ''The Great City'' or just ''The City'', is the only real metropolis on Raana. Founded by the adventurous second wave of settlers that landed on Raana's surface in 2230, over two and a half centuries ago, the Ikaanian city district of today boasts over 600,000 inhabitants and has a history that's rich in both tragedies and achievements. <br><br> The city lies on the Irendorian sea coast, nestled in a beautiful coral-crested bay that's blessed with an abundance of fish. <br><br> A mayor with absolute power governs the city, and he's directly connected to the ''Mastersphere'', either by lineage or wealth. He is also high commander of ''the Skyguard Forces'', an army of over ten thousand men, whose primary mission are to watch over Ikaanos and patrol the small townships outside the walls. The Skyguard also enforces Ikaanos' power and influence over the many tribal kingdoms that border the city. <<set $history to 0>> <</if>> <<if $history is 2>> <center><h2>THE SEVERANCE</h2></center> <hr color="black"> Sixty years after the second colony ship arrived at the Celassi star system and entered orbit around Raana, the Celassi quantum gate mysteriously shut down, making the return trip to Alpha Centauri and Earth impossible. <br><br> This occurred about 200 years ago, and it signaled the beginning of a dark era called //The Great Chaos//, during which scarcity and widespread violence permeated every aspect of society. Poor families sold themselves into slavery in order to avoid starving as the enormous colony devolved into a condition of existence that was practically post-apocalyptic. Expensive high-tech items, such as fusion-powered cars, computers, and food printers, were so scarce that only the elite of //The Sphere// could afford to purchase and maintain them. The Great Chaos came to an end after a generation, but it changed the once-thriving colony into a feudal kingdom that is still struggling against poverty, enslavement, and the constant threat of war to this day. <br><br> The Historical Society continues to debate why the severance happened. It remains the biggest enigma of all. A disturbing transmission captured just prior to the malfunction suggests that something assaulted the quantum gate at Alpha Centauri. The fundamental question is by who? Or by what? <br><br> No other sentient alien civilizations are known to humanity – other than the unknown architects of the quantum gates that link dozens of star systems together – and there were no simmering conflicts going on between the central star systems when the severance occurred. <<set $history to 0>> <</if>> <<if $history is 3>> <center><h2>- THE MASTERSPHERE -</h2></center> <hr color="black"> A gargantuan spaceship orbiting the planet of Raana. <br><br> The Mastersphere originated as a colony ship that passed through the Celassi quantum gate and entered orbit around planet Raana around 250 years ago. It was a modified space dreadnought — the USS Seneca – and carried the second wave of colonists. Onboard was an optimistic gathering of 5812 men and women from diverse socioeconomic groups, with a wide range of academic and professional skills. <br><br> Today, after centuries of instability and society-changing events, The Sphere is home to a small group of individuals commonly titled "The Spheremasters". They are descended from Ikaanos' founding families and wield unprecedented dominance over Raana's human societies. <br><br> Unlike Ikaanos, The Sphere still enjoys most of the luxuries that were widely available before the severance from Earth. On artificial gravity levels covering approximately 20 million square feet, a lucky guest may indulge himself in virtual worlds, inconceivable sex orgies, and experience cuisine that would launch him into an euphoria of never-before experienced deliciousness. <</if>> <<if $history is 4>> <center><h2>- THE KINGDOM OF DAVID -</h2></center> <hr color="black"> ''Population:'' 85,500<br> ''Capital:'' New Eden (6000)<br> ''Regent:'' King David VIII Binara<br> ''Size:'' 300 square miles (effective rule) – 250,000 sq miles (claimed)<br> <br> The Kingdom of David is the oldest human nation on Raana, situated roughly a two-week ride north of Ikaanos.<br><br>Founded in conjunction with the initial wave of settlers, around 360 years ago, it swiftly expanded to become the most prominent and well-governed body of authority among the original minor clans and town-states that settled the planet. <br><br> Its capital, The White City, formally called //New Eden//, lies in a lush swamp-infested valley that the Davidians have converted into a nearly impregnable stronghold with moats and concealed fortifications. <</if>> <<if $history is 5>> <center><h2>HAMILTON SQUARE</h2></center> <hr> You’re at the very heart of Ikaanos, the "Downtown" of the city. With its towering buildings, sophisticated restaurants and the historic town hall, you feel the palpable thrum of a bustling metropolis around you. But it all lies in the shadow of Crystal Hill, which mounts a rocky peninsula a few hundred yards to the east, forming bands of gleaming roofs and ivory facades – a perpetual reminder to the residents of Hamilton Square that there’s an unapproachable authority overseeing them. <<set $history to 0>> <</if>> <<if $history is 6>> <center><h2>QUEST STARTED: THE VAULT</h2></center> <hr> $girlname has consented to showing you the bunker room she talked about. <br><br> Assign the girl as a follower, take her to ''The Docks District'' and visit the Erenor Projects to start exploring her old residence. <br><<set _nobutt to true>> <<set $history to 0>> <</if>> <<if $history is 7>> <center><h2>NEW QUEST: THE HIDDEN GLADE</h2></center> <hr> $girlname has agreed to show you the place where her old gang resided before they botched their raid against the Kymanto transport. <br><br> ''Journal updated!'' <<set $quest_reb to 1>> <<set $history to 0>> <<set _nobutt to true>> <</if>> <<if $history is 8>> <center><h2>THE MAIDEN ISLANDS</h2></center> <hr> About 400 miles beyond the coast of Ikaanos lies the Maiden Islands - comprised of three major landmasses and thousands of lesser isles that form an archipelago in the shape of a crescent moon.<br><br> About 30 years ago, two boatloads of fugitive slaves and freebooters formed an outpost in the heart of this protected half-atoll with just a handful of tools and extremely primitive equipment. The endeavor was successful as this colony swiftly expanded into a relatively small metropolis that flourished off the rich foliage and fertile lands surrounding it. <br><br> Today, //Maiden Islands// is the glamorous ideal for many slaves who desire a second chance. But getting there is tough and exceedingly hazardous, assuming the fugitive ever manages to get past the shippers who’ll take both the ticket money and the profit from selling the slave back to its former master. <</if>> <<if $history is 9>> <center><h2>TUTORIAL: Setting a tone</h2></center> <hr> Sometimes, you’ll have the opportunity to address your slave in a different manner.<br><br> <b>Sadistic/Dominant:</b> A cruel approach that aims to degrade and humiliate your slave. Will most likely lower the girl’s disposition toward you, but there’s also a chance that you’ll decrease her ''WILLPOWER'' and make her more obedient. If your skill-roll succeeds, a sadistic tone might also shock the girl into telling you stuff that she wouldn’t do under normal circumstances. A sadistic/dominant tone is governed by the attribute //Manipulate//.<br><br> <b>Normal:</b> A cautious approach that seeks to do the least amount of damage possible while attempting to get information or influence your slave. Failure has a negligible effect on your standing with whomever you're speaking. <</if>> <<if $history is 10>> <center><h2>WESTSIDE DISTRICT</h2></center> <hr> INFO HERE. <</if>> <<if $history is 11>> <center><h2>HOUSE CYKER</h2></center> <hr> One of the great houses of Ikaanos. Possesses considerable influence and control over the colony's trading market. Although headquartered in southern //Crow's End//, the organization maintains influence over numerous buildings and other areas throughout the city. <br><br> House Cyker was created during //The Great Chaos// (circa year 2300) and swiftly grew to prominence, assisting Ikaanos in moving away from anarchy via the construction of huge factories and the arming of the newly formed Skyguard with reverse-engineered weaponry. <br><br> House Cyker dominates the construction market and provides over 90% of Ikaanos' population with manufactured goods. It also controls the logging industry outside Ikaanos, which has garnered a lot of enemies among //first wavers// due to the house's ruthless deforestation tactics. <br><br> Rivals to Kymanto Syndicate, House Teresto, and The Cult of The Elder. <</if>> <<if $history is 12>> <center><h2>THE BORDER WARS</h2></center> <hr> ''Involved sides:'' Ikaanos, Kingdom of David<br> ''Casualties (dead):'' 8,500<br> ''Date:'' 2484-2487 C.E.<br> ''Outcome:'' No change<br> <br> A conflict fought between the Skyguard army of Ikaanos and the soldiers of //the Kingdom of David//, as a response to the growing economic and demographic plunder of the //first wave settlements//. <br><br> <</if>> <<if $history is 13>> <center><h2>- THE FIRST WAVE -</h2></center> <hr color="black"> Over 350 years ago, the first wave of Raana's human inhabitants arrived through the Celassi Stargate. It was a handpicked group of 366 young people, entrusted with establishing an outpost capable of accommodating bigger groups over the next decade. Unfortunately, the first wave crashed their ship close to the //Beryll mountain range//, not far from where Ikaanos City now resides. <br><br> Unbeknownst to the //International Space Agency// on Earth, the majority of colonists survived the crash. However, communication with Earth was now impossible owing to the destroyed ship's primary, secondary, and backup deep space transmitters being irreparably damaged. <br><br> After a century, just a few earthly traditions remained. //The First Wavers// had established a tribal society more akin to a medieval world with swords and wooden carts than to their founding fathers' high-tech civilization, many of them also worshipping local deities and large creatures belonging to Raana's megafauna. <br><br> When //the Second Wavers// finally arrived from the skies nearly a century after the first wave crashed on Raana, the //First Waver// descendants refused to accept their new overlords and preferred to continue their medieval style of society, viewing the newcomers as a threat similar to what they'd been fighting in the jungles for as long as they could remember. <br><br> After the severance, //the First Wavers// well-established farmlands became popular to pillage or annex, a tradition that's continued ever since. Today, Ikaanos places a premium on crafts and other cultural artifacts, and tribal women are in high demand as sex slaves because to their petite stature and strengthened resilience. <</if>> <<if $history is 14>> <center><h2>- THE EXPLORER'S GUILD -</h2></center> <hr color="black"> Once an affluent and prominent institution with an almost limitless supply of resources for research into Raana, it remained a force to be reckoned with following the severance but gradually deteriorated into its current level of post-prestigiousness. Today, the Guild is merely a network of scholars and wealthy philanthropists whose influence is derived upon the Guild's past accomplishments. <br><br> The Guild, however, continues to send expeditions into the jungles in pursuit of clues about Raana's past, and they reward adventurers who deliver them valuable resources or rare medical plants. <<set $history to 0>> <</if>> <<if $history is 15>> <center><h2>- THE BORDERLANDS -</h2></center> <hr color="black"> The borderlands are a stretch of devastated forest separating Ikaanos and the Kingdom of David (the only remaining body of power from the first settlers). <br><br> Bandits, fugitive slaves, and fortune-seeking freebooters live in the region. The most notable is the newly founded "Group of Hope," a religious cult that worships a lizard-like deity and exhorts all slaves to rebel against their owners and join the order. <br><br> A recent attack against an Ikaanian redoubt has started a small skirmish-war between the Cult and Ikaanos. <</if>> <<if $history is 16>> <center><h2>- THE IRENDORIAN SEA -</h2></center> <hr color="black"> The Irendorian sea is the main body of water that separates the planet of Raana's two major continents. It is teeming with aquatic life and provides food and other resources to the Great City. The sea is also home to various terrifying predators, such as the monstrous //Charuck// – a 100-foot-long lizard-horror capable of making quick land attacks and annihilating whole villages in a matter of minutes. On //the Maiden Islands//, 250 miles east of the Great City, a larger township exists. <</if>> <<if $history is 17>> <center><h2>- THE SKYGUARD -</h2></center> <hr color="black"> The Skyguard serves as the police and military of Ikaanos. They are ruthless in their enforcement of all laws and the nobility's will, knowing that they hold a monopoly on the authorized use of physical force within the realm. <br><br> Before an initiate may join as a fully sworn member, he must face eight torturous months of training. However, a regular soldier receives several privileges, including barracks-appointed sex slaves, personal weapons, and immunity from a variety of offenses. <br><br> The typical Skyguard soldier is armed with a handgun or a bolt-action rifle and wears a protective vest. Certain higher-ranking officials are armed with lethal automatic weapons. <</if>> <<if $history is 18>> <center><h2>- THE KYMANTO SYNDICATE -</h2></center> <hr color="black"> One of Ikaanos' oldest organizations, founded over three centuries ago, and a well-known political entity having sway over all human settlements on the planet. <br><br> Officially governed by <b>THE RED COUNCIL</b>, which was comprised of the leaders of seven old-world families that held significant authority during the early years of Raana's colonization. However, the Kiduro family has occupied the chairman's position for the last century, and most other organizations regard them as Kymanto's true authority today. <br><br> Much of the organization's real power has faded during the years, after losing the monopoly on mechanical production and off-city trade. Kymanto still owns a sizable share of the slave market and retains its monetary flow from huge swaths of farmland outside Ikaanos. However, to stop the organization from fading into the shadows of history, something needs to happen soon. <</if>> <<if $history is 19>> <center><h2>- GENERAL TIMELINE -</h2></center> <hr> <ul> <li>''2025-2030:'' Due to climate change, migration and collapsing economies, Earth experiences a sharp decline in socioeconomic prosperity and agricultural production. <br/><br/></li> <li>''2028:'' The Pan-Asian Confederation (PAC) is formed between Russia, China and North Korea. The world sees a noticeable military buildup. <br/><br/></li> <li>''2030:'' World War III erupts as tensions between the Pan-Asian Confederation and NATO reach an all-time high.<br/><br/></li> <li>''2035:'' After the deliberate deployment of tactical warheads to annihilate a ground assault in western Belarus, World War III turns nuclear. <br/><br/> </li> <li>''2036: ''The darkest year of World War III. Tens of thousands of soldiers are lost each day in the trenches of Eastern Europe. The US successfully repels a submarine-deployed nuclear strike directed toward the west coast. <br/><br/> </li> <li>''2039:'' The Great Famine begins. Economic collapse on a global scale after three years of heatwaves, droughts and unnatural storms, combined with the obliterating consequences of war. 3.3 billion fatalities in nine months. World War III comes to an end. Stalemate between PAC and NATO. Parts of The Baltic and Eastern Europe remain as a nuclear wasteland up until the beginning of the 2100s.<br/><br/> </li> <li>''2040-2069:'' A world-spanning period of political turmoil and widespread lawlessness. Generally referred to as "The Second Dark Age" or "The Apocalypse". <br/><br/> </li> <li>''2070:'' Most of Earth has recovered from World War III, with the end of The Great Famine bringing unparalleled economic prosperity. <br/><br/> </li> <li>''2075-2095:'' Daniel Esterhazy pioneers advances in nanotechnology, fusion energy and anti-gravitational fields.<br/><br/> </li> <li>''2087:'' The first anti-gravity propelled starship, ESS Damodar, launches into space. <br/><br/> </li> <li>''2098:'' Behind Mars, the spaceship USS Govinda discovers an extraterrestrial quantum teleportation gate. <br/><br/> </li> <li>''2104-2150:'' The age of space exploration. Earth begins mapping a complex network of quantum gates spanning many solar systems. Fusion technology advancements and ultra-drives enable rapid space travel. <br/><br/> </li> <li>''2107:'' //We are not alone.// On the planet Avasul (YRB-12), evolved lifeforms are discovered on land and in water. Avasul is unfortunately an arid world devoid of sentient species. <br/><br/> </li> <li>''2109-2115:'' Space expeditions discover five more planets harboring life. They are not suitable for human colonization. <br/><br/> </li> <li>''2116-2117:'' Scientific expedition vessels discover the planets of Raana (YRB-43) and Atlantica (YRB-45). Both planets harbor life and their paradisaic climate favors human colonization. <br/><br/> </li> <li>''2130:'' USS Dorothea, the first colony ship heading for Raana, crashes upon entering the planet's atmosphere. Attempts to contact the expedition are unsuccessful. All are presumed dead after drones discover the charred wreckage in a remote valley. <br><br> </li> <li>''2132-2159:'' Great turmoil on Earth and in its trans-planetary colonies. The //Sino-Oceanic Collapse// in 2150; an unfortunate combination of famine, civic unrest and a 9.9 magnitude earthquake, kills 700 million people in Asia and Oceania.<br><br> </li> <li>''2197:'' Forming of the United Earth government.<br><br></li> <li>''2230:'' Space exploration resumes as Earth reaches an unprecedented level of peace and prosperity. This year, a massive colony ship (USS Seneca) departs for Raana and reaches the planet on Christmas Eve.<br><br> </li> <li>''2230-2289:'' Raana and Atlantica are colonized. In contrast to Atlantica's peaceful wildlife, Raana's jungles unleash a swarm of ferocious beasts on anybody who ventures more than three days from the newly erected fortified outposts.<br><br> </li> <li>''2290:'' "The Severance" shuts down the quantum gate between Alpha Centauri and the Celassi star system, also known as //Raana's star//. <br><br> </li> <li>''2290-2310:'' The colony of Raana is thrown into disarray as warlords and syndicates vie for dominance in the vacuum left by The Severance. For many decades, famine, enslavement and violence are the norm, and this grim reality pervades all new civic organizations that emerge from the ashes of the old colony. <br><br> </li> <li>''2489:'' Masters of Raana's start date. After two chaotic centuries, a feudal-like society has emerged on Raana, governed by the corrupted Republic of Ikaanos. Despite widespread destitution and slavery, Raana is now experiencing an age of opportunity that greatly rewards those who are courageous and resourceful.</li> </ul> <</if>> <<if $history is 20>> <center><h2>- STAY HEALTHY! -</h2></center> <hr> You cannot apply for factory work unless your ''Stamina points, Health, STAMINA'' and ''DEXTERITY'' have a value of 6 or more! <</if>> <<if $history is 21>> <center><h2>- OPTIONS -</h2></center> <hr> <center>''OPTION MENU ONLY AVAILABLE AT YOUR HOME OR WHILE OUTSIDE!''</center> <</if>> <<if $history is 22>> <center><h2>- THE BROTHERHOOD OF RYZAAN -</h2></center> <hr color="black"> More info soon! <<set $history to 0>> <</if>> <<if $history is 23>> <center><h2>- REDHAVEN DISTRICT -</h2></center> <hr color="black"> Redhaven, sandwiched between the slums of Westside and Red River, is a strange blend of poverty and opportunity. The marketplace, famous for being built on the site of the Second Waver's first village, offers an abundance of options; an adventurer can sell stolen merchandise, hire a prostitute, purchase trinkets, or gaze upon the sacred remnants of "the Irendor Shuttle," commemorating the first controlled landing on Raana. <br><br> Red River is well-known for its fishing. Swarms of fauns, eels, and dragon fish congregate in vast shoals around the outlet, providing an inexhaustible supply of delectable seafood to the city. Before venturing out onto the boardwalks, be sure to pick up a fishing pole at the market! <br><br> Furry's Tavern has something for everyone — free beer, gambling, boisterous company, and a warm body for the night. <</if>> <<if $history is 24>> <center><h2>- WHITEHAVEN DISTRICT -</h2></center> <hr color="black"> More info soon! <</if>> <<if $history is 25>> <center><h2>- WESTSIDE DISTRICT -</h2></center> <hr color="black"> More info soon! <</if>> <<if $history is 26>> <center><h2>- IKAANOS -</h2></center> <hr color="black"> ''Population:'' 1,900,000<br> ''Capital:'' Ikaanos city (600,000)<br> ''Head of state:'' Mayor Philip Lancour<br> ''Size:'' 50,000 sq miles<br> <br> Ikaanos, commonly known as "The Dominion of Ikaanos" or "The Colony," is the planet's largest human state. A mayor, appointed by The Second Republic's Senate, functions as the formal head of state and commander of the Skyguard forces in Ikaanos City. <br><br> The ultimate ruler of the colony is Chancellor Mordecai, aided by The Spheremasters, or senators; powerful men that control vast expanses of terrain and wield almost unlimited influence over Ikaanos' lower classes. <br><br> Ikaanos is officially a republic, yet it operates more like a medieval feudal system. The Spheremasters act as semi-independent lords, occasionally granting land as a reward for loyalty or great deeds. Many smaller tribal kingdoms and townships also swear fealty to Ikaanos; giving money or resources in exchange for protection against the terror . <br><br> Seven //Great Houses//, organizations built up around influential families or old companies, control much of Ikaanos' production facilities, trade markets and social entrepreneurships. The Great Houses resemble independent kingdoms that officially swear allegiance to The Chancellor but are powerful enough to act on their own. <br><br> Despite boosting a sizeable force of militiamen and high-tech marines, Ikaanos' adversaries are many. Numerous cults, worshiping strange forest deities and terrible gods from the seas, are a continual menace in Ikaanos city, especially after recent escalations. Large bandit chiefdoms, frequently associated with //The Kingdom of David//, are also a persistent thorn in the mayor's side, disrupting trade routes and vital supply lines on a regular basis. <br><br> The Prometheus kingdoms, "Lake City" and the "Hakusan Empire", more commonly known as "New Tokyo" by Ikaanians, are two autonomous regions that dominate the northern parts of IC. They're officially still part of the Ikaanian Republic and pay a trade-based tax to the //motherland// - but share very little in ways of culture and internal politics with their cousins in the south. <</if>> <<if $history is 27>> <center><h2>- HOUSE BELLEMME -</h2></center> <hr color="black"> One of Ikaanos' //Great Houses//. House Bellemme's influence is predominantly off-city, encompassing magnificent ranches and vast grasslands that supply the colony with livestock, grain, and coffee. <br><br> House Bellemme was founded in 2230 by two brothers, Simon and Geoffrey, who established the first farmlands on Ikaanos. Today, little remains of the naive farm builders of that era. Bellemme has grown into a formidable organization with hundreds of soldiers and ruthless commanders who profit from enslavement and conquest. <br><br> Additionally, the Great House is renowned for its spectacular feasts, which can accommodate thousands of guests. A guest is greeted by personal slaves, ostentatious attire, and extravagant presents that demonstrate the House's wealth. Five colossal fortifications ensure that the celebrations continue uninterrupted in the event that a giant lizard or a band of cultists decide to emerge from the surrounding forests. <br><br> House Bellemme mirrors a medieval kingdom in appearance and behavior, including not just its land management, but also its brutality and warrior-praising culture. <br><br> Rivals to Kymanto Syndicate and The Cult of The Elder. <</if>> <<if $history is 28>> <center><h2>- HOUSE TERESTO -</h2></center> <hr color="black"> A relatively new Great House in Ikaanos. House Teresto was established on the foundations of a technology firm that grew into a conglomerate together with two other enterprises. It wasn't until 2380 that it established itself as a force to be reckoned with, following the defeat of Cuh-Haram, a former //House Cyker// ally. <br><br> House Teresto is renowned for its expertise in computer hardware and is the only corporation capable of extracting components from ancient technology. Teresto is the operator of //The Grid// and is in charge of the last network-based storage facility, which is comprised of hundreds of small microchips from guidance control boards. This facility, called //The Flash Fort//, has around 10 TB of remaining storage capacity. Each kilobyte is valuable, and House Teresto pays handsomely for functioning technology components discovered by adventurers. <br><br> Rivals to House Cyker. <</if>> <<if $history is 29>> <center><h3>- DARIA'S GIFT -</h3></center> <hr color="black"> A powerful ability that activates under these conditions:<br> <ul> <li>Player has attended and finished ''Daria's Science and Mathematics''.</li> <li>Player has an ''INTELLIGENCE'' of 70 or higher.</li> </ul> Daria's gift gives a +20 CHARISMA modification when interacting with a character whose INTELLIGENCE is 49 or lower. <</if>> <<if $history is 30>> <center><h2>- CROW'S END -</h2></center> <hr color="black"> More info soon! <</if>> <<if $history is 31>> <center><h2>- THE DOCKS -</h2></center> <hr color="black"> More info soon! <</if>> <<if $history is 32>> <center><h2>- CAMPING -</h2></center> <hr color="black"> <center> ''//You need to upgrade your camp in the Follower menu to enable this feature!//'' </center> <</if>> <<if $history is 33>> <center><h2>- EMKIDS -</h2></center> <hr color="black"> Emkids, or Embois, is a name given to a group of extravagant upper-class or noble youths whose families live on Emerald Island. While mostly keeping themselves to finer establishments, emkids occasionally stroll Amber Mall or participate in private orgies at Dockgrave. <br><br> Most emkids stick to a strict style with bright colors, tattoos and tight leather pants – shifting their fashion choices based on popular musicians or other established figures in youth culture. They can often be seen wearing the crests that mark economic abundance – sunglasses, gold-plated buttons and an ornamented dagger sheath. <<set _nobutt to true>> <</if>> <<if $history is 34>> <center><h2>- QUEST STARTED: ASHBURY ESTATES -</h2></center> <hr color="black"> If I assign Amelia as a follower and take the girl to her old Master's estate, which lies abandoned on Harrow Island, I'm sure we could find some interesting loot and other artifacts. <br><br> Harrow Island is a remote land in the North Red River Basin – reachable from the Ferry at Darkmere. <<if $quest_amel is 1>><br><br>''Journal updated!''<<set $quest_amel to 2>><</if>> <<set _nobutt to true>> <</if>> </div> <<nobr>><div id="borderwrap"><div id="wrapper"> <div class="row"> <div class="story"> <<set $inside to true>> <<set $wopos to 5>> <<if $budman is undefined>><<set $budman to 5>><</if>> <<if $background is 105 or $credit gte 10000>><<set _invok to true>><</if>> <<if $talk3 is true>><<set _nogo2 to true>><</if>> <<if $action2 is false and $action3 is false>><div class="headsign">WALTON'S SMITHERY</div><</if>> <<if $action2 is true>><div class="headsign">RANGED WEAPONS</div><</if>> <<if $action3 is true>><div class="headsign">MELEE WEAPONS</div><</if>> <<if $action1 is false>> You’re inside Timothy Walton’s weapon store - an obsessively well-managed establishment with every item arranged in perfectly placed lines. <br><br>Two guards constantly patrol the ground floor, keeping freebooters and other ruffians away from thoughts of theft or mischief. <<if $npc.av30.state is 0>> <br><br> Timmy's troubled nephew, ''Bud Walton'', is currently employed here as a jack-of-all-trades.
